A young mum told she may not live to see her 27th birthday has got married after a miraculous recovery. 
Kelly Andrews was was struck down with an aggressive form of leukaemia and then a bout of pneumonia, Wales Online reports . 
She became so ill that her distraught family felt they had no choice but to start planning her funeral. Kelly Andrews getting married to Daniel Coombes (Photo: Craig Handfield) 
But after undergoing a successful stem cell transplant she was well enough to marry the love of her life just months later. Read More Meet the brave woman who is donating her body bit by bit to help others 
Kelly Andrews, who’s now Kelly Coombes after tying the knot to Daniel Coombes on December 30 at Bryn Meadows Golf Hotel & Spa, said the wedding was the perfect end to a truly dreadful year. 
“Twenty sixteen was the hardest year of my life but I can’t say that it was the worst because I got to marry my best friend at the end of it all,” said Kelly, 26. The couple tied the knot on December 30 (Photo: Craig Handfield) 
“The wedding was absolutely perfect and couldn’t have gone any better. I was treated like a princess all day from arrival until checking out. 
“I was actually very calm the entire day. I just kept thinking to myself that walking down the aisle to the man of my dreams was far easier than most other things I’ve had to deal with recently.” 
Kelly, from Caerphilly, first began to feel unwell in February 2016 and started coming up in lumps. 
It was initially thought she had a bad bout of flu but when she couldn’t lift her own head off her pillow she decided to call her out-of-hours doctor. 
After being seen at Ystrad Mynach Hospital she was sent to Prince Charles Hospital in Merthyr Tydfil where blood tests were carried out. The happy family didn't think this day would come (Photo: Craig Handfield) 
It was discovered the mum-of-one had leukaemia and would need to undergo chemotherapy. 
“All I kept on thinking was that my daughter Ruby wouldn’t remember me if I died,” added Kelly. 
“That just absolutely killed me inside. Ruby is my life and I couldn’t bear the thought of not seeing her grow up. 
“That actually gave me the strength I needed to fight this.” 
Doctors decided to carry on giving her treatments for both her cancer and pneumonia and amazingly she was soon well enough to undergo a stem cell transplant. 
Incredibly she pulled through and now needs just weekly hospital check-ups. 
Kelly and Daniel, who had been engaged three years, decided to enter the Bryn Meadows Golf Hotel & Spa ‘Win A Wedding’ competition when Kelly was well enough to return home. 
The pair beat 350 other entrants to land the prize worth more than £5,000. Read More Grieving mum horrified after "sick" trolls create fake Facebook profiles using pics of dead daughter 
More than 80 people were invited to the wedding ceremony, followed by 140 in the evening. The happy couple are now planning a honeymoon in Tenerife once Kelly is well enough to fly (Photo: South Wales Echo) 
“My little girl Ruby absolutely loved the wedding," her mum said. She was the flower girl,” added Kelly. 
“She definitely stole my thunder. She didn’t stop all day.” Like us on Facebook
